title: 2000–01 Segunda Liga
text:
The 2000–01 <a href="Segunda%20Liga">Segunda Liga</a> season was the 11th season of the competition and the 67th season of recognised second-tier <a href="Association%20football">football</a> in <a href="Portugal">Portugal</a>. As the <a href="Portuguese%20League%20for%20Professional%20Football">LPFP</a> took over all nationwide professional leagues the competition was renamed from Segunda Divisão de Honra to Segunda Liga.
Overview.
The league was contested by 18 teams with <a href="CD%20Santa%20Clara">CD Santa Clara</a> winning the championship and gaining promotion to the <a href="Primeira%20Liga">Primeira Liga</a> along with <a href="Varzim%20SC">Varzim SC</a> and <a href="Vit%C3%B3ria%20Set%C3%BAbal">Vitória Setúbal</a>. At the other end of the table <a href="Imortal%20DC">Imortal DC</a>, <a href="FC%20Marco">FC Marco</a> and <a href="SC%20Freamunde">SC Freamunde</a> were relegated to the <a href="Segunda%20Divis%C3%A3o">Segunda Divisão</a>.
